content:
I'm a scientist & engineer with a PhD in machine learning (ML) and a passion for (combinatorial) optimization.
During my PhD at Max Welling's group, I have published and been an (outstanding) reviewer at top ML conferences, on the topic of machine learning for combinatorial optimization / vehicle routing. I received a best paper honorable mention at ICML 2019 for my work on stochastic beam search and I have been a Research Scientist Intern at Google DeepMind. See Google Scholar for my papers and citations.
At ORTEC, I worked on various ML & optimization projects such as warehousing, load optimization and vehicle routing. I initiated and lead the team that won the 2021 DIMACS VRPTW (Vehicle Routing Problem with Time Windows) challenge and I initiated and organized the EURO Meets NeurIPS 2022 Vehicle Routing Competition with over 150 participants and 50 final submissions.
I have participated in many (ACM-ICPC style) programming and math competitions. While Python is my major tool, I have worked with many languages and I am a quick learner so I can code my way around. I like engineering, to build stuff and I will typically find a way to make things work, aiming for optimal results.
summary:
I'm a scientist & engineer with a PhD in machine learning (ML) and a passion for (combinatorial) optimization.
During my PhD at Max Welling's group, I have published and been an (outstanding) reviewer at top ML conferences, on the topic of machine learning for combinatorial optimization / vehicle routing. I received a best paper honorable mention at ICML 2019 for my work on stochastic beam search and I have been a Research Scientist Intern at Google DeepMind.
title: Wouter Kool

summary: In this thesis, we develop methods for using machine learning to solve combinatorial optimization problems, with a focus on vehicle routing problems. The thesis consists of two parts. In Part i (Chapters 3 and 4), we develop practical methods using machine learning models to solve different variants of vehicle routing problems. As these models represent probability distributions over combinatorial spaces, in Part ii (Chapters 5 and 6), we focus on sampling from such models and optimizing their parameters.
title: Learning and Optimization in Combinatorial Spaces with a Focus on Deep Learning for Vehicle Routing

summary: Deep Policy Dynamic Programming applies Dynamic Programming on a search space restricted using policy derived from a Deep Neural Network. This provides a powerful and flexible framework for solving Vehicle Routing Problems using Deep Learning.
title: Deep Policy Dynamic Programming for Vehicle Routing Problems

summary: A Review of the Gumbel-max Trick and its Extensions for Discrete Stochasticity in Machine Learning
title: A Review of the Gumbel-max Trick and its Extensions for Discrete Stochasticity in Machine Learning

summary: Hybrid Genetic Search for the Vehicle Routing Problem with Time Windows that ranked 1st in Phase 1 of the DIMACS VRPTW Challenge.
title: Hybrid Genetic Search for the Vehicle Routing Problem with Time Windows: a High-Performance Implementation

summary: Contributed talk at [NeurIPS 2021 I Can't Believe It's Not Better (ICBINB) Workshop](https://i-cant-believe-its-not-better.github.io/neurips2021/) about Unbiased Gradient Estimation with Balanced Assignments for Mixtures of Experts.
title: Unbiased Gradient Estimation with Balanced Assignments for Mixtures of Experts

summary: Unbiased gradient estimators for Mixture of Expert models with a limited capacity per expert.
title: Unbiased Gradient Estimation with Balanced Assignments for Mixtures of Experts

summary: Talk about learning to solve routing problems at the [Johannes Gutenberg-Unversit√§t Mainz](https://logistik.bwl.uni-mainz.de/).
title: Learning to Solve Routing Problems

summary: Talk about learning to solve routing problems at the [Eindhoven Reinforcement Learning Seminar](http://einreise.tilda.ws/).
title: Learning to Solve Routing Problems

summary: Invited talk at IPAM where I talk about Deep Learning and Combinatorial Optimization, especially [Deep Policy Dynamic Programming](/publication/deep-policy-dynamic-programming/).
title: Deep Learning for Combinatorial Optimization: count your flops and make your flops count!

summary: Ancestral Gumbel-Top-k sampling is a generic and efficient method for sampling without replacement from discrete-valued Bayesian networks.
title: Ancestral Gumbel-Top-k Sampling for Sampling Without Replacement

summary: AMLab seminar talk about Stochastic Beam Search, Ancestral-Gumbel-Top-k Sampling and the Unordered Set Estimator.
title: Gumbel Mathemagic

summary: Talk about learning to solve routing problems at the TU Eindhoven RL seminar.
title: Attention, Learn to Solve Routing Problems!

summary: [IlikeCLR](https://wouterkool.github.io/ilikeclr) allows to browse and like papers from [ICLR 2020](https://iclr.cc/virtual_2020/) to get instant (maximum 'like'-lihood) recommendations.
title: IlikeCLR

summary: Virtual Poster at ICLR 2020.
title: Estimating Gradients for Discrete Distributions

summary: AMLab lunch seminar about the [MNISET](https://github.com/wouterkool/mniset) dataset.
title: The MNISET dataset

summary: We derive a low-variance unbiased estimator for expectations over discrete random variables based on sampling without replacement.
title: Estimating Gradients for Discrete Random Variables by Sampling without Replacement

summary: Guest lecture about Monte Carlo Tree Search & AlphaGo for the UvA Reinforcement Learning 2019 course.
title: Monte Carlo Tree Search & AlphaGo (Zero)

summary: Talk about the intersection of Machine Learning and Operations Research for the Delft AI Meetup.
title: Machine Learning + Operations Research

summary: Long oral talk about Stochastic Beam Search at the International Conference on Machine Learning 2019.
title: Stochastic Beams and Where to Find Them

summary: AMLab seminar talk about Stochastic Beam Search.
title: Stochastic Beams and Where to Find Them

summary: Gave a talk about life after graduation, especially industry vs. academia.
title: Life after graduation

summary: Stochastic Beam Search finds a set of unique samples (without replacement) from a sequence model. This paper received a Best Paper Honorable Mention at ICML 2019!
title: Stochastic Beams and Where to Find Them: The Gumbel-Top-k Trick for Sampling Sequences Without Replacement

summary: Contributed talk at the ICLR 2019 Deep RL Meets Structured Prediction workshop.
title: Buy 4 REINFORCE Samples, Get a Baseline for Free!

summary: AMLab lunch seminar about dealing with numeric stability in Machine Learning.
title: Numeric Stability

summary: We construct REINFORCE estimators based on multiple samples with and without replacement and obtain a baseline for free!
title: Buy 4 REINFORCE Samples, Get a Baseline for Free!

content: I talked to De Dataloog about applying Machine Learning to Operations Research problems. Listen to the interview here (Dutch only).
summary: I talked to De Dataloog about applying Machine Learning to Operations Research problems. Listen to the interview here (Dutch only).
title: Interview with 'De Dataloog' (Dutch Podcast on Data and Machine Learning)

summary: Invited talk about Deep Reinforcement Learning for solving Routing Problems at the Utrecht Data Science meetup.
title: Learning to solve Routing Problems with Deep Reinforcement Learning

summary: Invited talk about learning to solve routing problems at NS (Dutch Railways).
title: Machine Learning for routing problems

summary: Talk about learning to solve routing problems at the 2nd conference of the EURO Working Group on the Practice of Operations Research.
title: Attention, Learn to Solve Routing Problems!

summary: Attention based model trained with REINFORCE with greedy rollout baseline to learn heuristics with competitive results on TSP and other routing problems
title: Attention, Learn to Solve Routing Problems!

summary: Talk about learning to solve routing problems at the Qualcomm Symposium on Advances in Deep Learning.
title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Logistics Problems

summary: Guest lecture about Monte Carlo Tree Search & AlphaGo for the UvA Reinforcement Learning 2018 course.
title: Monte Carlo Tree Search & AlphaGo (Zero)

summary: Talk about solving your Travelling Salesman Problem using Reinforcement Learning at the BeNeRL workshop on Reinforcement Learning.
title: Attention Solves Your TSP, Approximately

summary: AMLab seminar talk about solving your Travelling Salesman Problem using Reinforcement Learning and a model based on Neural Attention.
title: Attention Solves Your TSP

summary: [SET¬Æ Finder](http://www.set-finder.com) is an Android/iOS app that uses TensorFlow to run a Deep Neural Network on-device to find SETs in the [SET¬Æ card game](https://www.setgame.com/).
title: SET¬Æ Finder

summary: We present a new framework for the optimization of two-phase methods using a simple feedback mechanism. We apply the framework to three different problems: the pallet matching problem, the capacitated vehicle routing problem, and the resource assignment problem. We observe that using the framework we are able to significantly improve on the initial solution quality within just a few iterations.
title: Optimization of Two-Phase Methods using Simple Feedback Mechanisms

summary: I present the result of a field study in the US on the topic of Load Building, and develop the Pallet Grid Assignment algorithm: a two-phase approach for optimizing the loading of pallet in a container. This approach uses column generation with partial application of branch-and-price in the first phase, and a Mixed Integer Program in the second.
title: ORTEC Pallet and Load Building

summary: A framework is developed for automation of the card game SET. A SET card has four properties (quantity, color, fill and shape), which each can take three values. The goal is to find special combinations of three cards, of which each individual property is equal or totally different for all three cards. The paper researches how these SETs can automatically be detected from an image using Computer Vision, dealing with three problems sequentially: the locating of cards on the image, the classification of the cards and the finding of SETs amongst the cards.
title: Automation of the SET Card Game
